\bentry
\word[same(1)]{same}
\pron{seVmf}
\gl{\gu}
{\dictmeaning{%
\num{1} (halvomemx \eng{the} padada muMde \parx) adeV; Binanxvallxda;
beVreyAgirada; oMdeV: \eng{everyone was looking in the same direction}
parxtiyobabxrU oMdeV yA adeV dikikxnalilx noVDutitxdadxru. \eng{the
  same car was used in another crime} adeV kAranunx inonxMdu
aparAdhadalUlx baLasalAgitutx. \eng{saying the same thing over and
  over} matetx matetx adeV viSayavanunx heVLutAtx. 
\num{2} veYvidhayxvillxda; vayxtAyxsavillxda; badalAgada;
badalAvaNeyillxda; oMdeV riVtiya; adeV riVtiya; EkariVtiya;
EkatAnavAda: \eng{the life is perhaps a little same} baduku pArxyashaH
savxlpx oMdeV riVtiyadAgirutatxde. \eng{the same old story}
vayxtAyxsavillxda adeV rUDhiya haLeya kate. 
\num{3} (\sA\ \eng{this, these, that, those} -- ivugaLa muMde \parx)
(vayxkitx, vasutx yA viSayada bagegx) adeV; ideV; pUvoRVkatx; hiMde
heVLida; pUvaRsUcita; hiMde sUcisida yA ciMtisida: \eng{this same man
  was later my tutor} hiMde heVLida I manuSayxneV muMde nanage
guruvAda. \eng{what is the use of this same patience?} ideV
sahaneyiMda Enu parxyoVjna? \eng{these same politicians would now have
  us believe etc.} (tirasAkxrapUvaRkavAgi) ideV rAjkAraNigaLu nAvu
naMbali (itAyxdi) eMdu apeVkiSxsutAtxre. 
\num{4} (\eng{the} padada muMde \parx) adeV; oMdeV Ada; Binanxvallxda;
tadavxtAtxda; tadUrxpa; Eka -- rUpavAda, parxkAravAda;
vayxtAyxsavillxda; badalAgada: \eng{the same causes produce the same
  effects} oMdeV rUpada, EkarUpavAda kAraNgaLu oMdeV rUpada,
EkarUpavAda kAyaRgaLanunx utapxtitx mADutatxve. \eng{the same
  observations are true of the others also} aveV viVkaSxNegaLu itara
viVkaSxNegaLa viSayadalilxyU nijvAgive. \eng{all planets move in the
  same direction} ellx garxhagaLU oMdeV dikikxnalilx
calisutatxve. \eng{say the same thing twice over} oMdeV, adeV
viSayavanunx eraDeraDu sAri heVLu. \eng{bigotry is the same in every
  age} parxti yugadalilxyU aMdhABimAnadalilx vayxtAyxsaviradu. 
\hypertarget{same(1)5}{}
\num{5} EkakAldalilx; omemxgeV: \eng{do not speak at the same time}
EkakAldalilx mAtanADabeVDi. 
\num{6} AdarU; adeV kAlkekx yA kAldalilx (hiMde heVLidadxkekx
virudadhxveMdu toVruva, Adare nijvAda yA
  jAcnxpakadalilxTuTxkoLaLxbeVkAda viSayavanunx seVrisuvAga \parx):
  \eng{you have to be firm, but at the same time you must be
  sympathetic} niVnu daqDhanishacxya hoMdirabeVku, AdarU adeV kAlkekx
  sahAnuBUtiyiMdalU kUDirabeVku. 
\num{7} (\pArxparx) adeV Ada; beVreyallxda; Binanxvallxda: \eng{words
  of the same nature with those he had first heard} avanu modalu
keVLida bageyaveV yA savxrUpadaveV Ada padagaLu. 
\num{8} (A, adu, avu eMbaudakekx otutxkoDuva payARya padavAgi) A,
adeV, aveV; aSeTxV: \eng{at the same time that I am trying to stop it}
adanunx nAnu nililxsalu yatinxsutitxdadx kAldalilxyeV. \eng{to the
 same place where I had found it} adu nanage sikikxdadx
jAgakekxV. \eng{sailors received the same pay as soldiers} sipAyigaLa
saMbaLavanenxV (yA saMbaLadaSeTxV) nAvikarU paDedaru. \eng{gave the
 same answer as before} hiMdina utatxravanenxV koTTxnu.}} 

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{at the same time = \hyperlink{same(1)5}{${}^1$same(5 \& 6).}}
\num{2} \eng{in the same \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{boat(1) nuga(3)}{${}^1$boat}.}
\num{3} \eng{be of the same mind (about somebody \engit{or} something)}
(obabxna yA oMdara \vi) adeV aBipArxya hoMdiru; omamxta hoMdiru. 
\hypertarget{same1 pagu4}{}
\num{4} \eng{by the same \hyperref{kandict_t.pdf}{T}{token(1) pagu(1)}{${}^1$token}.}
\num{5} \eng{come (\engit{or} amount) to the same thing} adeV Pal yA
pariNAma yA athaR (\mo vu) Agu.
\num{6} \eng{it is all (\engit{or} just) the same} (nirAsakitxya yA
niSapxkaSxpAtada mAtAgi) elAlx oMdeV; vayxtAyxsaveVnU -- illx, mADadu.
\num{7} \eng{just the same} KMDitavAgi yA kaDADxyavAgi adeV, oMdeV, vayxtAyxsavillxde.
\num{8} \eng{much the same} aMthadeVnU yA aSeTxVnU vayxtAyxsavillx;
hecucx kaDame oMdeV.
\num{9}\eng{one and the same}= \hyperlink{same1 pagu4}{\pagu $(4)$}. 
\num{10} \eng{on the same wavelength (as somebody)} samAnamanasakxnAda; (obabxnoDane) samAnABipArxya matutx samAnAsakitx \mo vugaLanunx hoMdidudx, A kAraNdiMda avananunx athaR mADikoLaLxlu shakatxnAda.
\num{11} \eng{pay (somebody) in the same coin} tanage mADidadxkekx adeV bageya parxtiVkAra mADu.
\num{12} \eng{speak the same language} (\AmA) samAnABipArxya matutx
samAnAsakitx hoMdiru; omamxta hoMdiru. 
\hypertarget{same1 pagu13}{}
\num{13} \eng{the same} adeV yA avaneV; adeV, oMdeV -- vayxkitx yA vasutx yA viSaya. 
\num{14} \eng{the very same }= \hyperlink{same1 pagu13}{\pagu $(13)$}.}
\eentry

{\dictmeaning{

\alnum{a} taqpitx paDisuvudu.

\alnum{c} taqpatx manoVBAva; saMtuSiTx: \eng{heard this with great satisfaction} bahaLa taqpitxyiMda yA bahaLa saMtoVSadiMda idanunx keVLida.
\num{2} samAdhAna; taqpitxgoLisuva vasutx yA viSaya: \eng{is a great satisfaction to me} nanage idoMdu doDaDx samAdhAna, taqpitxgoLisuva viSaya.
\num{3} (sAlda) tiVruve; pUtiR saMdAya.
\num{4} (Saratutx, kataRvayx, vAgAdxnagaLa) pUreYke; neraveVrike; pAlne.
\num{5} pArxyashicxtatx.
\num{6} parihAra; samAdhAna; parxtiPal; daMDavAgi yA naSaTxBatiRgAgi paDedadudx, tegedukoMDadudx: \eng{demanded satisfaction} parihArakAkxgi otAtxyisida.
\num{7} (\deVva) kirxsatxna pArxyashicxtatx; manuSayxra pApagaLigAgi kirxsatxnu mADikoMDa pArxyashicxtatx: \eng{Christ is the satisfaction for our sins} namamx pApagaLige kirxsatxnu pArxyashicxtatx (kirxsatxna kaSaTxgaLanunx jgatitxna pApagaLige sariyAda parihAraveMdu deVvaru opipxdAdxne eMbathaRdalilx).
\num{8} davxMdavxyudadhx; Atamxgwrava kApADikoLaLxlu tanage avamAna mADidavana meVle mADuva davxMdavx yudadhxda avakAsha: \eng{give satisfaction} (Atamxgwrava rakiSxsalu) davxMdavxyudadhx mADu. \eng{demand satisfaction} (Atamxgwrava rakiSxsalu) davxMdavxyudadhxkekx AhAvxnisu.
\num{9} (saMshayada \vi) samAdhAna; saMdeVha nivaqtitx yA parihAra. 
\num{10} aMgiVkAra; sivxVkAra; opipxge; samamxti; (satayx \mo vanunx)
taqpitxkaraveMdu, vishavxsaniVyaveMdu dheYyaRvAgi aMgiVkarisuvudu yA
opupxvudu.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{could not get (\engit{or} could get no) satisfaction from the dealer} vAyxpAriyiMda yAva parihAravanUnx paDeyalAgalillx.
\num{2} \eng{enter satisfaction} (\nAyxshA) saMdAya dAKlisu; tiVmARnisida haN yA parihAra saMdAyavAgideyeMdu nAyxyasAthxnada dAKleyalilx namUdisu, bare.
\num{3} \eng{find satisfaction in} taqpitx yA samAdhAna paDe.
\num{4} \eng{give satisfaction}

\alnum{a} taqpitxkoDu; saMtaqpitxgoLisu.

\alnum{b} (Atamxgwrava rakiSxsalu) davxMdavxyudadhx mADu.
\num{5} \eng{if you can prove it to my satisfaction} nanage
opipxgeyAguvaMte niVnu adanunx sAdhisabalelxyAdare. 
\num{6} \eng{in satisfaction of} (\nAyxshA) (sAlda) tiVruveyAgi.
\num{7}\eng{make satisfaction} (\nAyxshA) (sAl) tiVrisu.
\num{8} \eng{their satisfaction at (\engit{or} with) the results} PalitAMshagaLa bagegx avara taqpitx yA samAdhAna.
\num{9} \eng{the satisfaction of not having to do it} adanunx mADabeVkAgillx eMba samAdhAna. 
\num{10} \eng{thinks only of present satisfaction} sadayxda parxtiPal yA taqpitxyaSaTxnenxV ciMtisutAtxne. 
\num{11} \eng{to one's satisfaction of} tanage opipxgeyAguvaMte, samamxtavAguvaMte.}

\bentry
\word[say(1)]{say}
\pron{seV}
\gl{\kirx} 
(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{said} \ucAcx\ seDf; vataRmAna \parxpu\
\Eva\ \eng{says} \ucAcx\ sesfZ; (\pArxparx) \parxpu vataRmAna \Eva\
\eng{saith} \ucAcx\ setf, divxtiVya puruSa vataRmAna \Eva\ \eng{sayst}
yA \eng{sayest,} \BU\ \eng{saidst} yA (\viparx) \eng{saidest}). 

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1}
\alnum{a} (nidiRSaTx padagaLanunx sAmAnayxvAgi mAtanADuva
dhavxniyalilx) heVLu; anunx; enunx; ADu; usiru; nuDi: \eng{`said
 Damn!'} `hALAgali!' eMdanu. \eng{said that he was satisfied}
tanage taqpitxyAyitu eMdu heVLidanu.

\alnum{b} heVLu; nuDi; padagaLalilxDu; shabadxgaLalilx -- nirUpisu,
vayxkatxpaDisu; aBivayxkitxgoLisu: \eng{that was well said} adanunx
cenAnxgi yA oLeLxya sheYliyalilx heVLide. \eng{cannot say what I feel}
nanage Enu aninxside eMbaudanunx heVLalAre, aBivayxkitxgoLisalAre.
\num{2} BaviSayx nuDi; AgutatxdeyeMdu heVLu, tiLisu:
\eng{says that there will be war} yudadhx AgutatxdeyeMdu (BaviSayx)
heVLutAtxne.
\num{3} heVLu; nuDi; tiLisu; ukatxvAgiru; nidiRSaTx
padagaLalilxru; nidiRSaTx pATha hoMdiru: \eng{the Bible says that thou
 shalt not steal} niVnu kadiyakUDadu eMdu beYbalf heVLutatxde
(beYbalinalilx heVLide). \eng{it says here that he was killed} avanu
kolegiVDAdaneMdu ililx ukatxvAgide. \eng{the clock says ten to six}
gaDiyAra $6$ gaMTege $10$ nimiSa ideyeMdu heVLutatxde,
tiLisutitxde.
\num{4} (\kaparx dalilx) (daqDhavAgi) heVLalAgiru;
nirUpitavAgiru; vaNiRtavAgiru; kaMThoVkatxvAgi ukatxvAgiru: \eng{the
 tree is said to be six hundred years old} A mara $600$ vaSaRgaLaSuTx
haLeyadeMdu heVLalAgide.
\num{5} (\AmA) (vayxkitxge EnanAnxdarU) mADalu
-- heVLu, tiLisu: \eng{he said to bring the car} kAranunx taralu avanu
heVLida.
\num{6} viSaya -- tiLisu, heVLu: \eng{spoke for an hour but
 didn't say much} oMdu gaMTe mAtanADida, Adare hecucx viSayaveVnanUnx
tiLisalillx.
\num{7} (vAdadalilx) heVLu; vAdavAgi yA nepavAgi -- niVDu,
muMdiDu, muMdoDuDx: \eng{there is much to be said on both sides} eraDu
pakaSxgaLa paravAgiyU heVLuvudu bahaLavAgide. \eng{have
 you anything to say for yourself?} ninanx paravAgi heVLuvudu,
muMdiDuvudu EnAdarU ideyeV?
\num{8} (aneVkaveVLe kamaRpada nirapeVkaSx
parxyoVgadalilx) (obabxna yA oMdara viSayavAgi) 

\alnum{a} aBipArxya heVLu yA tiLisu.

\alnum{b} niNRya heVLu; nidhARra tiLisu: \eng{there is no saying (\engit{or} it
 is hard to say ) who it was} avanu yAru yA yArAgidadx eMbaudanunx
(KcitavAgi) heVLalAguvudillx (yA heVLuvudu kaSaTx). \eng{do say which
 you will have} nimage yAvudu beVkenunxvudanunx (nidhARravAgi)
tiLisi.
\num{9} udAharaNeyAgi tegeduko; daqSATxMtavAgi sivxVkarisu: \eng{any
 country, say Sweden, might do the same} yAvudeV deVsha,
udA. sivxVDanf, adanenxV mADabahudu. 
\num{10} (nidiRSaTx saMKeyx \mo vanunx) sarisumAreMdu eNisu; hatitxra
hatitxra samaveMdu BAvisu: \eng{a few of them, say a dozen \engit{or} so}
avaralilx kelvaru, sumAru hanenxraDu athavA aSuTx jna. 
\num{11} (pArxthaRne, sotxVtarx, \mo vanunx) heVLu; paThisu; vAcana mADu. 
\num{12} (pATha \mo vanunx) opipxsu; bAyipAThavAgi, kaMThapAThavAgi --
heVLu, punarucacxrisu: \eng{can't say his tables} koVSaTxkavanunx
bAyipAThavAgi heVLalAra. 
\num{13} (kale \mo vugaLa \vi) (oLAthaRvanunx yA udedxVshavanunx)
heVLu; sUcisu; tiLisu: \eng{what is the director saying in this
 film?} nideRVshaka I sinimAdalilx tiLisutitxruvudeVnu? 
\num{14} usiru; ucacxrisu. 
\num{15} heVLu; mAtukoDu; Baravase koDu; vacana niVDu; vAgAdxna mADu:
\eng{you said you would come} niVnu barutitxVyeMdu heVLidedx, mAtu
koTiTxdedx. 
\num{16} Uhisu; kalipxsu; iTuTxko; BAvisu: \eng{say (\engit{or} let us say )}
enonxVN; hAgiTuTxkoLoLxVN. \eng{shall we say?} nAvu hAge
kalipxsikoLoLxVNveV? \eng{well, say it were true, what then?} sari,
adu nijveMdeV iTuTxkoLoLxVN, muMdeVnu?}}

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} heVLu; mAtADu. 
\num{2} (\kAparx, vidhayxthaRdalilx) usi(su)ru; tiLisu; heVLu:
\eng{what is your name, say!} ninanx hesareVnu, heVLu!
\num{3} = \hyperlink{say(1) pagu9}{\pagu $(9)$}.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{and so say all of us} nAvellxrU adanenxV, aMteyeV,
hAgeyeV heVLutetxVve, adeV aBipArxyapaDutetxVve; namemxllxra
aBipArxyavU adeV.
\num{2} \eng{easier said than done} ADuvudu sulBa, mADuvudu kaSaTx;
mADuvudakikxMta heVLuvudu sulBa.
\num{3} \eng{go without saying} heVLabeVkAgillx; sapxSaTxvAgiyeV ide;
sahajvAgiyeV ide: \eng{it goes without saying that I will help you}
ninage nAnu sahAya mADutetxVneMbaudanunx heVLabeVkAgillx (eMdare
sapxSaTxvAgiyeV ide).
\num{4} \eng{how say you?} (\nAyxshA) (nAyxyadashiRgaLanunx
keVLuvalilx) niVvu EnanunxtitxVri? nimamx aBipArxya yA tiVmARna Enu?
\num{5} \eng{I \hyperref{kandict_d.pdf}{D}{dare(2) nuga}{${}^2$dare} say}.
\num{6} \eng{I'm not saying} nAnu A parxshenxge utatxra koDuvudillx,
utatxra koDalu nirAkarisutetxVne.
\num{7} \eng{I cannot (\engit{or} could not) say} nAnu heVLalAre; nanage
gotitxllx.
\num{8} \eng{I must say} (TiVke mADuvAga) nAnu heVLabeVku:
\eng{I must say that is silly} adu athaRhiVna eMdu nAnu
heVLabeVkAgide.
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu9}{}
\num{9} \eng{I say !} (\birx) el! are! (gamana seLeyuva, saMBASaNe
AraMBisuva, AshacxyaR sUcisuva udAgxrada mAtu): \eng{I say , who was
that?} are, avanu yAru? \eng{I say , what a beauty!} ayAyx, eSuTx
suMdara!
\num{10} \eng{it is said} (hAge, aMte) ADike yA vadaMti ide. 
\num{11} \eng{I'll say} (\AmA) hwdu -nij, diT.
\num{12} \eng{let us say} udAharaNeyAgi; daqSATxMtavAgi. 
\num{13} \eng{never say die} nirAshe paDabeVDa; Ashe tayxjisabeVDa.
\num{14} \eng{not to say} matutx nijvAgi; jotege vAsatxvavAgi:
\eng{his language was irreverent, not to say blasphemous} avana BASe
agwravadAdxgitutx, jotege nijvAgi pASaMDavU Agitutx.
\num{15} \eng{said he etc; said I} avanu modalAdAdxgi heVLida. nAnu heVLide.
\num{16} \eng{say a few words} oMderaDu mAtu ADu; savxlpx EnAdarU heVLu; puTTx BASaN mADu.
\num{17} \eng{say a good word for} 

\alnum{a} (oMdara yA obabxna paravAgi) oMdu
oLeLxya mAtu ADu; hogaLu; shiPArasu mADu. 

\alnum{b} (obabxnanunx) samathiRsu. 
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu18}{}
\num{18} \eng{say away} heVLabeVkAdudanunx heVLibiDu, odaribiDu. 
\num{19} \eng{say for oneself} (saMBASaNeya yA BASaNda aMshavAgi, dhATiyalilx) (EnanAnxdarU) heVLu; (yAvudanAnxdarU) ADu. 
\num{20} \eng{say much (\engit{or} something) for} (oMdara yA obabxna \vi) bahaLa heVLu; oLeLxya, utatxma guN tiLisu; hogaLu; shAlxGisu.
\num{21} \eng{say no}

\alnum{a} illxvenunx; nirAkarisu.

\alnum{b} ADalillxvenunx.

\alnum{c} Aguvudillx enunx; opapxdiru.
\num{22} \eng{say no more} (yAvudAdarU viSayada bagegx) mAtu nililxsu; bAyi mucucx; mAtu sAkumADu.
\num{23} \eng{say nothing to} (\rUpa) (obabxnige) EnanUnx mADadiru; (obabxna meVle) yAvudeV pariNAma yA parxBAva uMTumADadiru; (obabxnanunx) savxlpxvU taTTxdiru.
\num{24} \eng{say on } = \hyperlink{say(1) pagu18}{\pagu $(18)$}. 
\num{25} \eng{say one's piece} tAnu heVLabeVkAdadxnunx heVLu, ADabeVkAdadxnunx ADu.
\num{26} \eng{say out} sapxSaTxvAgi, pUtiRyAgi, bAyibiTuTx -- heVLibiDu.
\num{27} \eng{say over} nenapiniMda heVLu; kaMThasathxvAgi paThisu.
\num{28} \eng{say (person) nay} 

\alnum{a} (obabxna koVrikege) illxvenunx; nirAkarisu.

\alnum{b} viroVdhisu; virudadhxvAgi nuDi.
\num{29} \eng{say so} hAge heVLu; aMte nuDi: \eng{you may
 well say so} niVnu dhArALavAgi hAge heVLabahudu; ninanx heVLike
pUtiR nAyxyabadadhxvAgide, samathaRniVyavAgide. 
\num{30} \eng{say something} EnAdarU heVLu; savxlpx mAtanADu; puTTx BASaN mADu.
\num{31} \eng{say something for} (oMdara yA obabxna paravAgi) EnAdarU oLeLxyadanunx heVLu; savxlpx hogaLu. 
\num{32}\eng{says you!} (\AmA) (apanaMbike sUcisuva udAgxra) shudadhx abadadhx! nAnu opupxvudillx! nAnu samamxtise! 
\num{33} \eng{say the word} oMdu mAtu heVLu: 

\alnum{a} apapxNe (\mo vanunx) koDu.

(sAkeniside yA sAku mADabeVku) eMdu heVLu.

\alnum{a} hwdenunx; Agali enunx; Agutatxde enunx.

\alnum{c} (heVLikeyanunx) opipxko; daqDhapaDisu.
\num{36} \eng{sooth to say} nijdalilx; vAsatxvavAgi; nij
heVLabeVkeMdare.
\hypertarget{say(1) pagu(37)}{}
\num{37} \eng{so to say} hAge heVLuvudAdare yA heVLabahudAdare;

\num{38} \eng{strange to say} AshacxyaR veMdare: \eng{strange to say
he won}  AshacxyaRveMdare, avanu gedadx. 
\num{39} \eng{suffice to say} iSuTx heVLuvudu sAku (heVLabahudAdudu inUnx beVkAdaSiTxdadxrU sadayxkekx) heVLiruvaSuTx sAku.
\num{40} \eng{that is to say} 

\alnum{a} eMdare; beVre mAtugaLalilx heVLuvudAdare; susapxSaTxvAgi
heVLuvudAdalilx : \eng{the whole family, that is to say , four
 persons} iDiV kuTuMba, eMdare, nAlukx jna. 

\alnum{b} athavA -- kaDege, konege, koneya pakaSx, kaniSaThx pakaSx: \eng{he never went, that is to say , it is not recorded that he did} avanu hoVgaleV illx, athavA koneya pakaSx, avanu hoVgidadxneMdAdarU dAKlAgillx.
\num{41} \eng{the less (\engit{or} least) said the better} mAtu kaDame mADidaSUTx yA heVLuvudu kaDameyAdaSUTx oLeLxyadu; AdaSuTx mAtanunx kaDame mADuvudu sariyAda mAgaR. 
\num{42}\eng{the said} (\nAyxshA yA \hA) pUvoRVkatx ; hiMde heVLida :

\num{43} \eng{they say} jna heVLutAtxre; eMdu jnavadaMti, gALimAtu ide.

\num{4} (\AmA) kAyaRda yA Asakitxya keSxVtarx: \eng{not my scene} nananx
kAyaRkeSxVtarxvalalx.

\alnum{a} (nATka, calnacitarx, pusatxka, \mo vugaLalilx) oMdeV sathxLadalilx, \sA\ pAtarxgaLalilx badalAvaNe illxde, naDeyuva saMgatigaLa viBAga.

\alnum{b} aMkada oMdu viBAga: \eng{Act II, scene 1} eraDaneya aMka,

 duel scene in Hamlet} hAyxmelxTf nATkadalilxna suparxsidadhx
davxMdavx yudadhxda daqshayx.
\num{8} (yAvudeV vayxkitxya jiVvanada oMdu parxmuKvoV
sAvxrasayxkaravoV Ada) GaTneya -- kathana, vaNRne, daqshayx:
\eng{scenes from clerical life} pAdirx jiVvanada kelvu daqshayxgaLu.
\num{9} nijjiVvana, kathe, \mo vugaLalilxna yAvudeV GaTne, saMgati: \eng{distressing scenes occurred} viSAdakaravAda GaTnegaLu naDeduhoVduvu.

\num{11} raMgadaqshayx; siVnu; raMgasathxlda meVle yAvudeV GaTneya daqshayxvanunx parxdashiRsalu odagisuva, vaNRcitarxN mADida paradegaLu, halgegaLu, \mo vu.

\num{13} (sutatxlU haraDiruva) nisagaRda, parxkaqtiya daqshayx yA
noVT: \eng{a silvan scene} vanAMtara daqshayx. \eng{a desolate scene}
pALunoVT; goVLu kareyutitxruva vijnadaqshayx.}}

\bentry

\pron{siV}
\gl{\kirx} (\BU\ \eng{saw} \ucAcx- sA; \BUkaq\ \eng{seen} \ucAcx- siVnf). 
\gl{\sakirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} noVDu; kANu; IkiSxsu: \eng{can you see that fly?} niVnu A noNvanunx noVDabalelxyA?
\num{2} (mAnasikavAgi yA bwdidhxkavAgi) garxhisu; tiLi; ari; athaR mADiko: \eng{I see what you mean} niVnu heVLuvudu athaRvAyitu; ninanx athaR gotAtxyitu. \eng{could not see the joke} A hAsayx athaRvAgalillx; A hAsayxvanunx athaRmADikoLaLxlAgalillx.
\num{3} (sinimA, paMdayx, \mo vanunx) noVDu; viVkiSxsu.
\num{4} (parxshenx yA shoVdhane yA AloVcaneya mUlka) kaMDuhiDi; gotutxmADu; nidhaRrisu: \eng{could you go and see what the children are doing?} niVnu hoVgi makakxLu Enu mADutitxdAdxreMdu noVDutitxVyA? \eng{I will see what I can do to help} sahAya mADalu nAnu Enu mADabahudeMbaudanunx noVDutetxVne, nidhaRrisutetxVne.
\num{5} yoVcisu; BAvisu; parigaNisu; Uhisu: \eng{I see that you are a brave man} niVnobabx dhe YyaRvaMta eMdu UhisutetxVne.
\num{6} niriVkiSxsu; muMgANu; muMBAvisu: \eng{we saw that no good would come out of it} adariMda oLeLxyadu EnAdarU AgutatxdeyeMdu nAvu niriVkiSxsalillx. \eng{his colleagues saw him as a future prime minister} avana sahoVdoyxVgigaLu avananunx obabx BAvi parxdhAnamaMtirxyanAnxgi muMgaMDaru.
\num{7} (\sA\ vidhayxthaRdalilx, pusatxkavoMdanunx yA pusatxkadalilxna BAgavoMdanunx) mAhitigAgi -- noVDu, avaloVkisu: \eng{see page 15} hadineYdaneya puT noVDu.
\num{8} saMdhisu; BeVTiyAgu; BeVTi mADu; hatitxravidudx gurutisu:
\eng{I saw your mother yesterday} nAnu nenenx nimamx tAyiyanunx kaMDe,
noVDide, BeVTiyAde.
\num{9} (pirxya saMgAtiyAgi) yAranAnxdarU niyatavAgi saMdashiRsu,
BeVTi mADu, saMpakiRsu yA yAra joteyAdarU savxlpx kAlkaLe: \eng{she
does not want to see him any more} inunx muMde avananunx noVDalu,
avana jote seVralu avaLige iSaTxvillx. \eng{he is still seeing that
short girl} avanu inUnx A kuLiLxyanunx noVDutitxdAdxne, A kuLiLxyoDane
saMpakaR iTuTxkoMDidAdxne.
\num{10} BeVTi koDu; saMdashiRsu: \eng{the doctor will see you today} veYdayxru iMdu ninanxnunx BeVTi mADutAtxre.
\num{11} salhegAgi -- hoVgu, BeVTi mADu, saMdashiRsu: \eng{went to see the doctor} veYdayxranunx noVDalu hoVda, salhe keVLalu hoVda.
\num{12} (\kanmu\ daqshayxmUlvoMdariMda) ari; tiLi; noVDidadxriMda garxhisu: \eng{I see the show has been cancelled} parxdashaRna radAdxdudanunx (patirxke, parxkaTne, \mo vanunx noVDi, Odi) arite.
\num{13} noVDu; kANu; aBipArxya taLe yA athaR kalipxsu: \eng{I see
things differently now} viSayagaLu Iga nanage beVre riVti kANutitxve;
Iga nAnu viSayagaLanunx beVre daqSiTxyiMda noVDutetxVne (avugaLa

\bentry
\word{seem}
\pron{siVmf}
\gl{\kirx} 
{\dictmeaning{(hAge, hAgiruvaMte) toVru, kANu: \eng{be what you
 seem (\engit{or} seem to be)} toVruvaMte iru; niVnu
 EnAgiruvaMte kANutitxVyoV adeV Agiru; iruvudeV oMdu, toVruvudeV
 oMdu, AgabeVDa; soVgu hAkabeVDa; kapaTi AgirabeVDa; ASADhaBUtiyAgirabeVDa. \eng{he seemed to be the ringleader} avaneV
 guMpina muKMDanAgi kaMDa. \eng{he seems to be tired}
 AyAsagoMDavanaMte toVrutAtxne. \eng{he seems to be a
 good fellow} avanu oLeLxya AsAmiyaMte kANutAtxne. \eng{he is not
 the angel he seems to be} (noVDuvudakekx) avanu heVge
 kANutAtxnoV aMtha deVvate, sherxVSaThx vayxkitx EnU allx. \eng{I
 seem to see him still} avananunx nAnu (nananx
 kaNeNxdurinalilx) kANutitxruvaMte toVrutitxde.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{can't seem to do (something)} (\AmA)
(yAvudanenxV) mADalAre yA mADalAra (\mo) eMdu, toVru: \eng{somehow I
 can't seem to write anything to-day} ivatutx EkoV EnanUnx
bareyaleV Are eMdu toVrutitxde; ivatutx EkoV EnanUnx bareyalu
AgadaMtide. 
\num{2} \eng{do not seem to} (\AmA) EkoV Agutitxllx : \eng{I do not seem to like him} avananunx kaMDare nanageVkoV Agutitxllx.
\num{3}\eng{it seems that . . .} aMte: \eng{it
 seems that you were lying} niVnu suLuLx heVLutitxdadxMte
toVrutatxde. 
\num{4} \eng{it seems to me that etc. . . .} eMdu nanage
toVrutatxde: \eng{it seems to me that it will rain today}
ivatutx maLe baruvudeMdu nanage toVrutatxde. \eng{it seems
 to me that such talk is absurd} iMtaha mAtu asaMbadadhxveMdu nanage
toVrutitxde. 
\num{5} \eng{it would (\engit{or}} \pArxparx\ \eng{should) seem
 etc.} (apirxyavAda aBipArxya \mo vanunx koDuvAga, jAgarUka
sheYliyalilx mAtanADuva riVti) -- eMdu toVrutatxde. \eng{it would
 seem that the contemplated scheme is not practicable} Iga
yoVcisutitxruva yoVjneyu vayxvahAyaRvallxveMdu toVrutatxde; Iga
yoVcisutitxruva yoVjneyanunx kAyaRrUpakekx taralAguvudillxvenisutatxde. 
\num{6} \eng{seem good to} sariyAgiruvudAgi kANu; oLeLxyadu
eMdu toVru: \eng{this course seems good to me} I vidhAnavu
oLeLxya dAri eMdu nanage toVrutatxde. 
\num{7} \eng{so . . . (\engit{or} it seems)} AdadxriMda
. . . . aMte: \eng{so we are to get nothing, it seems}
AdadxriMda namage EneVnU siguvudillx vaMte, namage EneVnanUnx
koDuvudillxvaMte. 
\num{8} \eng{what seemeth him good} (\pArxparx) yAvudanunx avanu oLeLxyadeMdu BAvisu tAtxnoV (adu). 
}
\eentry

\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{be frightened out of one's senses} gAbariyiMda baudidhx sAvxdhiVna tapipxhoVgu: \eng{at the very sight of the cobra, he was frightened out of his senses} A nAgarahAvanunx noVDidaSaTxkekxV gAbariyiMda avanige baudidhx sAvxdhiVna tapipxhoVyitu.
\num{2} \eng{be in one's senses} parxjecnx sariyAgiru; baudidhx sAvxdhiVnadalilxru, neTTxgiru: \eng{are you in your senses?} ninage baudidhx sariyAgideyoV illxvoV?
\num{3} \eng{be out of one's senses} baudidhx -- keTiTxru, neTTxgillxdiru; viveVkashUnayxvAgiru: \eng{he is out of his senses} avanige baudidhx keTiTxde; avanige viveVka hoVgibiTiTxde.
\num{4} \eng{bring a person to his (\engit{or} her) senses} 

\alnum{a} (mUCiRta vayxkitxyanunx) ecacxrakekx taru; parxjecnx barisu. 

\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (aviveVkige) baudidhx barisu; viveVka taru: \eng{by his touching advice he brought his errant son to his senses} tananx manamuTuTxva baudidhxvAdadiMda Ata tapupx dAri hiDididadx tananx maganige baudidhx barisida.
\num{5} \eng{come to one's senses} 

\alnum{a} (mUCeR tiLidu) parxjecnx baru; ecacxra hoMdu.

\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (tananx aviveVkavanunx managaMDu) baudidhx paDe; viveVka gaLisiko; baudidhx kalituko: \eng{after that bitter experience he came to his senses} A kaTuvAda anuBavavAda meVle avanu baudidhx kalitukoMDa.
\num{6} \eng{errors of sense} iMdirxyajnayx doVSagaLu; iMdirxyagaLa (doVSadiMda uMTAda) tapapxrivugaLu.
\num{7} \eng{in a (\engit{or} one) sense} oMdu athaRdalilx, oMdu daqSiTxyiMda (noVDidare); yAvudeV viSayavanunx, heVLikeyanunx, oMdu siVmita daqSiTxyiMda parishiVlisidare, parigaNisidare: \eng{what you say is true in a sense} niVnu heVLutitxruvudu oMdu daqSiTxyiMda, oMdathaRdalilx nij.
\num{8} \eng{make sense} athaRkoDu; athaR hoMdiru; athaRvAgu: \eng{does it make any sense ?} adakekxVnAdarU athaR videye? \eng{it makes no sense at all} adakekx EneVnU athaRvillx.
\num{9} \eng{make sense of} athaR kalipxsu; I athaR eMdu heVLu, vivarisu: \eng{at last I made some sense of that cryptic statement} kaTTxkaDege nAnu A gUDhavAda heVLikege yAvudoV oMdu athaR kalipxsikoMDe.
\num{10} \eng{man of sense} viveVki; vAyxvahArika baudidhxya, tiVkaSx Nxbaudidhxya manuSayx.
\num{11} \eng{sense of direction} dikf parxjecnx; dikakxrivu; yArU mAgaRdashaRna mADadidadxrU tAnu yAva dikikxnalilx hoVgabeVkeMdu yA hoVgutitxdedxVneMdu ariyuva shakitx.
\num{12} \eng{sense of \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{humour(1) pagu(5)}{${}^1$humour}.}
\num{13} \eng{take leave of one's senses} hucucx hiDi; baudidhx keDu;
baudidhx kaLedukoMDiru; parxjecnx hALAgiru: \eng{have you taken leave

\num{14} \eng{take the sense of the meeting} sAmAnayxvAgiruva
aBipArxyavanunx gotutxmADu, vicArisu.
\num{15} \eng{the five senses} paMceVMdirxyagaLu; kaNuNx, kivi, mUgu,
nAlge matutx camaRveMba aidu iMdirxyagaLu.
\num{16} \eng{the pleasures of sense} (iMdirxyacApalyxvanunx
taqpitxpaDisuva) viSayasuKgaLu; iMdirxyaBoVgagaLu.
\num{17} \eng{the sixth sense} SaSeThxVMdirxya:

\alnum{a} \eng{(\engit{or} muscular sense )} mAMsaKMDa matutx sAnxyugaLa
parisharxmada saMveVdaneyanunxMTu mADuva shakitx; sAnxyu -- jAcnxna,
saMveVdane.

\alnum{b} aMtaboRVdhe; atiVMdirxya jAcnxna; iMdirxyAtiVta jAcnxnavanunxMTumADuvudeMdu BAvisalAda iMdirxyAtiVta shakitx.
\num{18} \eng{the religious sense} dhAmiRkaparxjecnx. \eng{the moral

\num{19} \eng{under a sense of wrong} anAyxya BAvaneyalilx;

\bentry

{\dictmeaning{

\num{2} (obabx yajmAnanige, yajmAnige) ALAgiru; nwkaranAgiru; seVvakanAgiru (\akirx\ saha).
\num{3} (yAvudeV) vayxkitxge, saMsethxge, seYnayxkekx, deVshakekx (\kanmu\ videVshagaLalilx) -- seVve salilxsu.
\num{4} (vayxkitxya, pArxNiya yA kAyaRkekx beVkAda) agatayxgaLanunx pUreYsu: \eng{two buses serve the area} eraDu basusxgaLu A parxdeVshada agatayxgaLanunx pUreYsutatxve.
\num{5} yAvudeV udedxVshakekx yA kAyaRkekx -- baru, odagu, neravAgu,
upayoVgavAgu, parxyoVjnakekx baru, sAdhakavAgu: \eng{it
 serves the purpose} adu (niriVkiSxsida) udedxVshavanunx
pUreYsutatxde, nivaRhisutatxde. \eng{to serve some private
 ends} yAvudeV sAvxthaRvanunx sAdhisikoDu; yAvudeV sAvxthaRkekx
sAdhakavAgu. \eng{that excuse will not serve you} A
nevadiMda ninageVnU upayoVgavAguvudillx. \eng{nothing will
 serve him but absolute submission} saMpUNR sharaNAgatiya
horatu beVrAvudariMdalU avanige parxyoVjnavillx. \eng{a sofa serving
 him as (\engit{or} for) a bed too} avanige hAsigeyAgiyU upayoVgakekx baruva
(yA hAsigeya kelsakUkx odaguva) oMdu soVphA. 
\num{6} avadhi pUreYsu:

\alnum{a} (adhikAriya \vi) niyatavAda adhikArAvadhi pUtiR seVve salilxsu.

\alnum{b} (kelsa kaliyuva kasabaudArana \vi) karArinalilx nigadipaDisida avadhipUtiR kelsa mADu.

\alnum{c} (daMDanege guriyAdavana \vi) daMDaneya yA shikeSxya avadhipUtiR seremaneyalilx vidhisida kelsa (\mo vanunx) mADu.
\num{7} (seYnayx) (PiraMgi sAlu, PiraMgi, \mo vanunx) hArisutatxleV iru.
\num{8} (\nw) (hagagxgaLu \mo vanunx) saNNx huriyiMda kaTiTx bigi.
\num{9}
\alnum{a} (UTda meVjda meVle) UT baDisu.

\alnum{b} (aDige padAthaRgaLanunx) UTda meVjda meVle -- iDu, irisu,
sidadhxgoLisu: \eng{fish, which was almost cold was served up}
hecucxkaDime taNNxgAgi hoVgidadx mInanunx baDisalAyitu. \eng{toasted
 slices of bread were served with butter} hurida berxDiDxna
bilelxgaLanunx beNeNxyoDane baDisidaru. \eng{serve up dinner}
BoVjnakekx (aDige padAthaRgaLanunx meVjina meVle)
sidadhxpaDisu. \eng{ladies and gentlemen, dinner is served}
mahiLeyareV, mahaniVyareV BoVjna sidadhxvAgide, (meVjina meVle)
sidadhxgoLiside.
\num{10} (yAvudanenxV) haMcu; vitarisu; vitaraN mADu: \eng{serve ammunition} siDimadadxnunx vitaraN mADu. \eng{serve out (\engit{or} round) rations} (seYnikaru \mo varige) paDitaravanunx haMcu.
\num{11} (vayxkitxge, girAkige, vasutxgaLanunx) sarabarAju mADu;
odagisikoDu: \eng{the firm served its customers with various goods} A
vANijyxsaMsethx tananx girAkigaLige bagebageya sarakugaLanunx
sarabarAju mADutitxtutx. \eng{the Municipal Council serves the whole
  town with water and gas} muyxnisipalf saBeyu Urigellx niVranUnx,
(aDigeya) anilvanUnx odagisutatxde.
\num{12} koVTiRna Ajecnxyanunx vidhivatAtxgi jAri mADu: \eng{served a warrant on him} avana meVle (yA avanige) vAreMTu jAri mADida. \eng{served him with a summons} avanige samanfsx jAri mADida.
\num{13} (Tenisf, bAYxDfmiMTnf) savfR mADu:

\alnum{a} ATda AraMBada ceMDanunx hoDe; modal ceMDanunx hoDedu AT AraMBisu.

\alnum{b} hiVge savfRmADi (tapupx \mo vanunx) mADu.
\num{14} (vayxkitxyoMdige) nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx -- vayxvaharisu,
naDeduko, vatiRsu; (vayxkitxyanunx) nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx -- kANu:
\eng{served me shamefully} avamAnakaravAgi nanonxMdige vatiRsida,
nananxnunx kaMDa. 
\num{15} (deVvate \mo vakekx) seVve salilxsu; keYMkayaR mADu.

saMBoVgisu.
\num{17} (yAvaneV vayxkitxge) moVsa mADu; ToVpi hAku; kutaMtarx
naDesu.}}

\noindent

\dictmeaning{

kasabaudArana \vi) karArina avadhipUtiR kelsa mADutitxru.

\bentry
\word[shoot(1)]{shoot} 
\pron{SUTf}
\gl{\kirx} (\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{shot} \ucAcx\ SATf) 

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1}
\alnum{a} tiVra veVgavAgi, raBasadiMda -- kaLuhisu, ese, oge, horahAku, dabaubx: \eng{the bow shoots arrows} bilulx bANgaLanunx ogeyutatxde. \eng{the gun shoots out missiles} baMdUku kiSxpaNigaLanunx eseyutatxde. \eng{the coaches collided and shot out the passengers} A reYlugADigaLu parasapxra Dikikx hoDedu parxyANikaranunx horakekxsedubiTuTxvu. 

\alnum{b} (kiraN \mo vugaLa \vi) biVru; sUsu; mUDisu: \eng{the sun shoots his rays} sUyaRnu tananx kiraNgaLanunx biVrutAtxne. \eng{trees shoot out their new twigs} maragaLu tamamx hosa reMbegaLanunx mUDisutatxve. \eng{he shot a glance at his neighbour} avanu tananx nereyavana(La) kaDege OrenoVT biVrida.
\num{2} (kasa \mo vanunx bauTiTx, toTiTx, lAri \mo vugaLiMda) suri; celulx; ese; hAku: \eng{she shot the rubbish out of the basket} Ake kasakaDiDxyanunx bauTiTxyiMda horakekx suridaLu, esedaLu.
\num{3} (kadada cilkavanunx BadarxpaDisalu yA tegeyalu, aguLiyanunx, tApALanunx) raBasadiMda -- hAku, taLuLx, nUku yA eLe.
\num{4} (PiraMgi, bilulx, \mo vugaLiMda) guMDu, bAN, \mo vanunx -- eseyisu, hArisu, hAruvaMte mADu.
\num{5} (bilulx, baMdUku, \mo vugaLa mUlka) bAN, guMDu, \mo\ kiSxpaNiyanunx -- hArisu, parxkeSxVpisu, ese.
\num{6} (vayxkitxyanunx yA pArxNiyanunx baMdUku, bilulx, \mo vugaLiMda) guMDu, bAN, \mo vanunx parxyoVgisi -- gAyagoLisu yA kolulx.
\num{7} (vayxkitxyanunx shikeSxya rUpadalilx) baMdUkiniMda, bANdiMda -- kolulx.
\num{8} (pode, jmInu, \mo vugaLalilxruva beVTe pArxNiyanunx, vanayx maqgavanunx) beVTeyADu; SikAri mADu; guMDikikx yA bAN hoDedu kolulx.
\num{9} (\kanmu\ phuTfbAlf) ceMDanunx birusAgi odedu goVlf mADu. 
\num{10} (gAlfphx, \AmA) sutotxMdakekx nidiRSaTx saMKeyxya sokxVrf gaLisu, mADu.
\num{11}(daqshayx, vayxkitx, \mo vara) calnacitarx yA BAvacitarx tege. 
\num{12} (\ame, \AmA)

\alnum{a} kArxYxpfsx, pUlf, \mo\ ATvADu. 

\alnum{b} (dALa) ese; hAku; uruLisu.
\num{13} (doVNiya \vi) (seVtuve, jlpAta, \mo vugaLa) aDiyalilx yA (iLijAru parxvAhada) meVle veVgavAgi sAgu; birusAgi hoVgu. 
\num{14} (\ashi) (mAdaka vasutxvanunx) tAneV, tanageV -- cucicxko.
\num{15} (\AmA) (cwkadalilx, vaqtatxdalilx keMpudiVpa toVrisutitxdadxrU rasetxyanunx) -- dATu, hAdu hoVgu, atikarxmisi hoVgu. 
\num{16} (halgeyoMdara ENnunx, aMcanunx OrekoVreyillxdaMte) samanAgi yA karAruvAkAkxgi -- hatatxri hoDe, samaru, nayagoLisu.}}

\noindent
\gl{\akirx} 
{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} veVgavAgi, birusAgi -- calisu; raBasadiMda -- baru yA hoVgu: \eng{the boat shot out from the creek} doVNiyu KAriyiMda horakekx raBasadiMda baMtu yA horaTitu.
\num{2}
\alnum{a} (giDada \vi) kuDiyiDu; cigaroDe; konaru; ciguru; aMkurisu. 

\alnum{b} (giDada \vi) mogugx biDu; mogugx kacucx.

\alnum{c} (ciguru, mogugxgaLa \vi) moLe; kANisiko.
\num{3} (kirxkeTf ceMDina \vi) nelkekx baDidu, puTveVLade -- nelsamakekx uruLu, neldudadxkUkx ODu.
\num{4} (noVvina \vi) 

\alnum{a} caLuku -- koDu, huTiTxsu, niVDu. 

\alnum{b} (beVrAvudeV avayavada \vi) niMtu niMtu caLaku -- baru, noVyu, yAtaneyAgu.

\num{5} idadxkikxdadxMte horaTuko; muMcAcu; horacAcu; cAciko: \eng{the cape shoots out all at once} A BUshiravu idadxkikxdadxMte muMcAcikoMDide.
\num{6} (\kanmu\ nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx) baMdUku \mo vanunx hArisu, biDu: \eng{he shoots straight} avanu neVravAgi baMdUku hArisutAtxne, bAN biDutAtxne.
\num{7}
\alnum{a} (bAN, guMDu, \mo\ kiSxpaNigaLa \vi, bilulx, baMdUku, \mo
vugaLiMda)hAru; parxkeSxVpavAgu. 

\alnum{b} (baMdUkina \vi) hAru; hoDe.
\num{8}
\alnum{a} baMdUkiniMda pArxNi yA vanayxmaqga beVTeyADu.

\alnum{b} jmInu \mo vugaLalilx (pArxNiya) beVTeyADu; SikAri mADu.
\num{9} (\kanmu\ phuTfbAlf) ceMDanunx goVlige birusAgi ode.}}

\noindent 
\gl{\pagu} 
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{shoot !} (\ame, \ashi) odaribiDu; birabirane heVLibiDu.
\num{2} \eng{shoot ahead} (sapxdhiRgaLu \mo vara \vi) muMBAgakekx, muMcUNige, agarxsAthxnakekx -- beVga baru.
\num{3} \eng{shoot a line} (\birx\ \AmA) yAvudanenxV vipariVta utepxrXVkiSxsi, naMbalAgadaMte yA ADaMbaradiMda -- heVLu, vaNiRsu.
\num{4} \eng{shoot down}

\alnum{a} (vayxkitxyanunx) guMDikikx, guMDu hoDedu -- sAyisu, kolulx.

\alnum{b} (PiraMgi \mo vanunx hArisi vimAna yA vimAnacAlkananunx) nelkikxLisu; hoDedu uruLisu; hoDedu keDavu.

\alnum{c} (vayxkitx, yAvudeV salhe, \mo vakekx virudadhxvAgi) balvAgi vAdisu; pariNAmakAriyAgi, parxbal -- vAda hUDu.
\num{5} \eng{shoot it out} (\ashi) niNARyakavAda koVvikadanadalilx toDagu, guMDina kALagadalilx BAgavahisu.
\num{6} \eng{shoot one's \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bolt(1) nuga(2)}{${}^1$bolt}.}
\num{7} \eng{shoot one's cuffs} SaTiRna maNikaTuTx paTiTxyanunx (parxdashiRsalu, toVrisikoLaLxlu) odaru, koDavu.
\num{8} \eng{shoot oneself in the foot} (\aupa) alkaSxyXdiMda, ajAgarUkateyiMda -- tanageV toMdare mADiko, tananx kAlnenxV muriduko, iruva sithxtiyanunx inanxSuTx keDisiko.
\num{9} \eng{shoot one's mouth off} (\ashi)

\alnum{a} vipariVta yA lMgulgAmillxde mAtanADu; hadudx hatoVTi illxde haraTu.

\alnum{b} viveVcaneyillxde haraTu.
\num{10} \eng{shoot out} (\pArxparx) (tuTi \mo vanunx, \kanmu\ aNkisuva saluvAgi) horacAcu; muMdakekx niVDu.
\num{11} \eng{shoot the breeze (\engit{or} the bull)} (\kanu\ \ame, \AmA) mAtukateyADu; anwpacArikavAgi mAtanADu; sAMparxdAyika mAtukateyalilx toDagu. 
\num{12} \eng{shoot the cat} (\ashi) kakukx; vAMti mADu.
\hyperdef{S}{shoot(1) pagu(13)}{}
\num{13} \eng{shoot the moon} (\birx) pAvatimADabeVkAda bADige koDuvudanunx tapipxsikoLaLxlu rAtorxVrAtirx sAmAnugaLanenxllx sAgisibiTuTx parAriyAgu 
\num{14} \eng{shoot the sun} akASxMshavanunx gotutxmADalu, naDuhagalige sariyAgi AkAshadalilx sUyaRna ucACxrXyavanunx kaMDuhiDi.
\num{15} \eng{shoot through} (\AseTxrXV\ matutx nUyxsiZVleMDf) (\ashi) horaTuhoVgu; parAriyAgu; palAyana mADu; ODi hoVgu; gADi biDu; jAga KAlimADu; tale tapipxsikoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{16} \eng{shoot up}

\alnum{a} beVga beLe; (\kanmu\ vayxkitxya \vi) beVga etatxravAgu 

\alnum{b} idadxkikxdadxMte meVlkekxVru.

\alnum{c} sikAkxbaTeTx guMDu hArisi (parxdeVshavanunx) tallxNgoLisu, BiVtigiVDumADu.

\alnum{d} tanage tAneV mAdaka padAthaR cucicxko.}

\bentry
\word[simple(1)]{simple} 
\pron{siMpa(pf)lf}
\gl{\gu} 
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} saraLa: 

\alnum{a} EkadhAtu savxrUpada; Eka GaTkada; saMyukatx yA misharxN Agirada: \eng{simple substance} saraLa vasutx; EkadhAtu; EkaGaTka; oMdeV mUl dhAtuvanonxLagoMDa vasutx. 

\alnum{b} Eka parxkirxyeya; oMdeV parxkirxyege yA yAvudeV parxkirxyege oMdeV bAri oLapaDuva.

\alnum{c} sAmAnayx; EkAMshavuLaLx: \eng{simple sentence} saraLa vAkayx; oMdeV parxdhAna vAkayxvanonxLagoMDu, adhiVna yA upa vAkayxvillxda vAkayx; oMdeV kataRqpada matutx oMdeV kirxyApadavanunx oLagoMDiruva vAkayx. 

\alnum{d} EkarAshi matutx EkaGAtagaLa: \eng{simple equation} saraLa samIkaraN; oMdeV GAtada oMdeV rAshiyanunx yA biVjsaMKeyxyanonxLagoMDa samIkaraN.

\alnum{e} EkAMshavuLaLx; aviBakatx illxve avishelxVSayxvAda.
\num{2} saraLa; sulBa; sAmAnayx; sAdhAraN:

\alnum{a} toDakAgillxda; jTilvallxda: \eng{a simple style} saraLa, sulBa -- sheYli.

\alnum{b} alMkAramayavallxda; analMkaqta; nirABaraN; nirADaMbara: \eng{it is a simple , and not an ornate, style} adu saraLa sheYli, nirADaMbaravAda sheYli. \eng{simple beauty} analMkaqta, nirADaMbara, sahaj -- swMdayaR.

\alnum{c} BoVgavasutxgaLillxda: \eng{a simple meal} sAdhAraN, sAmAnayx -- BoVjna, UT. \eng{the simple life} saraLa jiVvana; BoVgavasutxgaLu, kaqtaka vinoVdavilAsagaLu, \mo vanunx vajiRsi nisagaRsahajvAda bALanunx bALuvudu.

\alnum{d} asaMkiVNR; tiVra toDakina aMgagaLu yA BAgagaLu illxda; jTilvAda racaneyallxda: \eng{simple forms of life} (jiVva vikasana karxmadalilx) atayxlpx vikAsa hoMdiruva jiVvajAtigaLu; saraLa jiVvigaLu.
\num{3} bariya; keVval; shudadhx: \eng{the simple truth} shudadhx satayx. \eng{it is a simple majority, that is all} adu keVval bahumata, aSeTx. \eng{his story is a simple invention} avana kathe bariya DoVMgi, shudadhx saqSaTxne.
\num{4}
\alnum{a} saraLa; sAmAnayx; noVT, naDenuDigaLalilx sAdhAraNvenisuva: \eng{he has a simple manner} Ata naDenuDigaLalilx sAmAnayxnaMtidAdxne. \eng{a simple attire} saraLavAda uDupu.

\alnum{b} saraLa; sahaj; sAvxBAvika; niSakxpaT; akaqtirxma; sAcA; kaqtakate illxda; sAdhuvAda: \eng{a simple person} niSakxpaT manuSayx; saraLa vayxkitx; sAdhu, BoVLe -- manuSayx.
\num{5} tiLivaLike yA anuBava illxda; ajacnx; daDaDx; mUDha; maMdabaudidhx; ananuBavi: \eng{I am not so simple as to be taken in so easily} aSuTx sarAgavAgi moVsahoVguvaSuTx ajacnx, ananuBavi nAnallx.
\num{6} saraLa; sulBa; aritukoLaLxlu yA mADalu sarAgavAda, kaSaTxveVnU allxda: \eng{he gave a simple explanation} (ariyalu) sulBavAda vivaraNeyanunx avanu koTTx. \eng{the problem is very simple} A samaseyx bahaLa saraLa; A samaseyxyanunx bageharisuvudu bahu sulBa. \eng{the malady can be cured by a simple technique} sulBa taMtarxdiMda A vAyxdhiyanunx guNpaDisabahudu.
\num{7}
\alnum{a} sAmAnayx; keLadajeRya; nimanx vagaRda; diVna sithxtiya; gaNyx vagaRdavarallxda: \eng{they are simple folk belonging to the lowest strata of society} avaru samAjda atayxMta keLadajeRgaLige seVrida diVnajna.

\alnum{b} alpx; gaNniVyavallxda; mahatatxravallxda: \eng{her simple efforts to please the guests were quite charming} atithigaLanunx saMtoVSa paDisalu Ake mADida alpx parxyatanxgaLu moVhaka vAgidudxvu.
\num{8} (\savi) saraLa:

\alnum{a} oMdeV oMdu aMgavuLaLx.

\alnum{b} (kAyi athavA haNiNxna \vi) oMdu shalAkeyiMda Ada.} 
\eentry

\dictmeaning{

\num{10} \eng{sit in}

\alnum{a} (kAmiRkaru, vidAyxthiRgaLu, \mo vara \vi) dharaNi kuLituko; (yAvudeV saMsethxya kaTTxDavanunx yA adara oMdu BAgavanunx, AkarxmisikoMDu tamamx goVLanonxV dUranonxV parishiVlisi itayxthaRpaDisuvavaregU yA tamamxnenxV alilxMda hora dUDuvavaregU alelxV) kuLitu, idudx -- parxtiBaTisu, parxtiBaTnAtamxka parxdashaRna naDesu.

\num{11} \eng{sit in for} (oMdara) sAthxna vahisu; jAga tegeduko; (oMdakekx) payARyavAgiru, badaliyAgi vatiRsu, kAyaRmADu.

\hypertarget{sit1 pagu15}{}

\alnum{b} AturavAgi kaLacu, tegedu hAku: \eng{slip on (\engit{or} over) a shirt} beVga SaTuR tagulisiko. \eng{slip off a shirt} beVga SaTuR kaLacu. . kaLaciko; tapipxsiko; jAriko; nuNuciko; keYkoDu; gasutx koDu: \eng{dog slips his collar} nAyi koraLapaTiTxyiMda kaLacikoLuLxtatxde. \eng{the prisoner slipped his guard} keYdi avana kAvalugAranige gasutx koTTx, kAvalugAraniMda tapipxsikoMDa. \eng{the point had slipped my attention} A aMsha nananx gamanadiMda tapipxsikoMDitutx, jAritutx.}}

boVnasf koDuva maTiTxge avaru saMtuSaTxrAgidadxru. \eng{so many men,
  so many minds} eSoTxMdu maMdiyoV aSoTxMdu manasusxgaLu,
aBipArxyagaLu, BAvanegaLu.
\num{2} (niSeVdhavAciyoDane) aSuTx; aSaTxra -- maTiTxge, tanaka,
varege: \eng{was not so late as I expected} nAnu niriVkiSxsidaSuTx
taDavAgalillx. \eng{am not so eager as you} ninanxSuTx nAnu
kAtaranAgillx. \eng{so expensive that few can afford it} eSuTx
dubAriyeMdare adanunx koLaLxlu yArigU sAdhayxvillx. \eng{so small as
  to be invisible} kANisadaSuTx cikakxdAgide. \eng{am not so foolish
  as to agree to that} nAnu adakekx opipxge niVDuvaSuTx
daDaDxnallx. \eng{did not expect to live so long} aSuTx diVGaRkAl
badukuvudanunx niriVkiSxsalillx.
\num{3} aMte; hAge; hiVge: \eng{I want to leave and so does she} nAnu
hoVgabeVkeMdidedxVne, aMteyeV avaLU. \eng{you said it was good, and so
  it is} adu cenAnxgideyeMdu niVnu heVLide, adu hAgeyeV ide. \eng{why
  are you panting so ?} niVneVke hiVge Edusiru biDutitxdidxVye?
\eng{as the tree falls, so it must lie} mara heVge biVLutatxdeyoV
hAgeyeV adu bidudxkoMDirabeVku. \eng{so , and so only, can it be done}
hAge, matutx hAge mAtarxveV, adanunx mADalu sAdhayx.
\num{4} iSuTx; aSuTx; aSaTxra maTiTxge: \eng{so high you cannot reach
  it} ninage eTukalAradaSuTx etatxradalilx. \eng{have known him since
  he was so high} avanu (keYyiMda toVrisutAtx) iSuTx

\bentry
\word[some(1)]{some} 
\pron{samf}
\gl{\gu} 
\dictmeaning{
\num{1}
\alnum{a} yAvanoV obabx, yAvaLoV obabxLu; yAroV obabx: \eng{some fool has locked the door} yAvanoV muTAThxLa bAgilige biVga hAkidAdxne. \eng{ask some experienced person} yAvanAdarU anuBavasathx vayxkitxyanunx keVLu. 

\alnum{b} yAvudoV oMdu; obAbxnobabx; oMdAnoMdu: \eng{in some book (\engit{or} other)} adanunx nAnu yAvudoV (oMdallx oMdu) pusatxkadalilx kaMDe. \eng{I will tell you about it some day} eMdoV, yAvudoV oMdu dina A viSayavanunx ninage heVLutetxVne. 

\alnum{c} (\bava) yAroV kelvaru; yAvudoV kelvu: \eng{some people say yes, and some (or others) say no} yAroV kelvu maMdi uMTu, hwdu, enunxtAtxre, inunx yAroV kelvu maMdi illx, allx, enunxtAtxre.
\hypertarget{some(1)2}{} 
\num{2} (parxmAN yA saMKeyxya \vi) savxlpx; koMca: \eng{drink some water} savxlpx niVru kuDi. \eng{eat some bread} koMca berxDuDx tinunx. \eng{put in some more effort} inUnx savxlpx hecucx parxyatanx mADu. 
\num{3} (saMKeyxya \vi) savxlpx; kelvaru yA kelvu: \eng{some people were late} savxlpx jna, kelvu maMdi (ellxrU allx), taDavAgi baMdaru. \eng{let me have some apples} nanage kelvu seVbina haNuNxgaLanunx koDi. 
\num{4} (parxmAN yA saMKeyxya \vi) sAkaSuTx; takakxSuTx; sumAru; kelvoMdu : \eng{we had to go some miles out of our way} nAvu namamx dAri biTuTx kelvoMdu meYli hoVgabeVkAyitu. \eng{I had some little trouble in arranging it} adanunx joVDisuvudaralilx nanage sAkaSuTx sharxmavAyitu. \eng{I have been waiting (for) some time} nAnu sAkaSuTx hotitxniMda kAyutitxdedxVne. \eng{some years ago} sumAru vaSaRgaLa hiMde. 
\num{5} (\birx) savxlpxmaTiTxna; aSUTx iSaTxra; idadxdadxralilx savxlpx (parxmANda); oMdaSuTx: \eng{this is some guide} idu savxlpxmaTiTxna mAgaRdashaRkavAgide. \eng{that is some help} adariMda savxlpx, takakxSuTx sahAya Agutatxde. \eng{that is some proof} idu idadxdadxralilx oMdaSuTx rujuvAtu. 
\num{6} (\AmA) diTvAda; nijvAda; sariyAda; pUNARthaRdalilx iMthavanunx yA iMthadu enanxbahudAda: \eng{this is some war} nijvAda yudadhx ideV; yudadhx eMdare idu. \eng{I call him some hero} avananunx nAnu nijvAda viVra enunxtetxVne. \eng{I call that some poem} adanunx nAnu sariyAda kavana eMdu kareyutetxVne; kavana eMdare adu enunxtetxVne. 
\num{7} (\sA\ otitx heVLidAga) kaniSaThx pakaSx; alpxvAdarU; savxlpxvAdarU; eLaLxSATxdarU; raveyaSATxdarU: \eng{do have some mercy on the state of my health} nananx AroVgayx sithxtiya meVle eLaLxSATxdarU daye toVrisu. \eng{he has after all some sense of decency} EneV Agali avanige raveyaSATxdarU mayARdeya arivu ide. 
\num{8} (parxmANda yA saMKeyxya \vi) hecucx kaDime; sumAru: \eng{he weighs some fifteen stone} avanu hecucxkaDime hadineYdu soTxVnf ($210$ pwMDu) tUgutAtxne. \eng{it was some 20 minutes to 9} oMbatutx gaMTege sumAru ipapxtutx nimiSa (kaDime) itutx.} 
\eentry

manavarike mADikoMDa. \eng{he arrived soon after four} avanu nAlukx
gaMTeyAdoDane(yeV) baMdu muTiTxda. \eng{soon after the gate was
  closed} horabAgilu mucicxda kUDaleV. \eng{least said, soonest
  mended} eSeTxSuTx kaDime mAtanADidare aSaTxSUTx beVga parisithxti
neTTxgAgutatxde.
\num{2} iSaTxralelxV; savxlpxdaralelxV; sadayxdalelxV;
anatikAldalilxyeV: \eng{we shall soon know the result}
PalitAMshavanunx nAvu sadayxdalelxV ariyutetxVve.
\num{3}(vAcayxvoV sUcayxvoV Ada hoVlikeyoDane) manasAre; saMtoVSavAgi;
saMtoVSadiMda; KuSiyAgi; iSaTxdiMda: \eng{I would just as soon stay at
  home (as go)} (hoVguvudakikxMta) saMtoVSavAgi maneyalelxV
idedxVnu. \eng{I would soon er die than let my father find out this
  folly of mine} I nananx aviveVkavanunx namamxpapx
kaMDukoLuLxvudakekx munanxveV saMtoVSadiMda satetxVnu. \eng{which
  would you sooner (\engit{or} soon est) do?} (ivugaLa peYki) yAvudanunx
mADalu ninagiSaTx?
\num{4} hotitxge muMce; beVga: \eng{what makes you come so soon ?}
iSuTx beVga ninanxnunx ililxge baramADida kAraNveVnu? \eng{you spoke a
  bit too soon} niVnu savxlpx muMceyeV mAtanADibiTeTx.}}
 
\noindent

\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{as (\engit{or} so) soon as} A(da) kUDaleV; A kaSxNveV;
takaSxNveV; Ada oDaneyeV: \eng{I came as soon as I heard of it}
adanunx nAnu keVLida kUDaleV baMdubiTeTx. \eng{he will get there as
  soon as they do} avaru alilxge talupidoDaneyeV avanU
taluputAtxne. \eng{I did not arrive so (\engit{or} as) soon as I expected}
nAnu niriVkiSxsidaSuTx beVga talupalillx. \eng{he drops his fine

tananx sogasAda sidAdhxMtagaLiMda tananx sAvxthaRkekx dhakekx baMda
kUDaleV avugaLa keYbiDutAtxne. \eng{as soon as ever there is any talk

taNNxgAgutAtxne.
\num{2} \eng{no sooner... than} A kaSxNdalelxV; A kUDaleV;
tatfkaSxNveV; tatfkaSxNdalelxV: \eng{no sooner said than done}
heVLida kUDaleV, Ayitu -- aMtiTuTxko, aMtanunx, aMta tiLiduko. \eng{it
  was no sooner said than done} heVLida utatxra kaSxNdalelxV adanunx
mADiyU Ayitu.
\num{3} \eng{sooner \engit{or} later} iMdoV muMdoV; eMdAdarU; (muMde) eMdoV

  took a spring} avanu oMdu negeta negeda. \eng{he rose with a spring}
avanu negedu meVledadx.
\num{2} 
\alnum{a} vasaMta(Qutu, kAl); giDamaragaLu ciguruva utatxrAdhaR
goVLadalilx mAciRyiMda meVvaregina, dakiSxNAdhaRgoVLadalilx
sepaTxMbariniMda naveMbarfvaregina kAl; pAshicxmAtayxra
lekAkxcAradalilx caLigAl matutx beVsageya madhayxda, BAratiVya
lekAkxcAradalilx shishira matutx girxVSamxgaLa madhayxda Qutu.

\alnum{b} (\Kavi dalilx) meVSa saMkArxMtiyiMda kakARTka
saMkArxMtiyavaregina avadhi.
\num{3} (\rUpa) jiVvanada -- navoVdaya, vasaMtakAl. 
\num{4} \eng{= \hyperlink{spring tide(1)}{${}^1$spring tide}.}
\num{5} (niVru, eNeNx , \mo vu ukikx baruva) cilume; baugegx; UTe;
kAraMji: \eng{hot springs} bisi niVrina UTegaLu. \eng{mineral springs}
Knij jlda cilumegaLu.
\num{6} (nibaRMdhada sithxtiyiMda) hinenxgeta; hiMpuTita: \eng{the
  backward springs of the bow} bililxna hinenxgeta.
\num{7} sithxtisAthxpakatavx; savxsithxtige matetx maraLuva shakitx:
\eng{these mattresses have no spring in them} I hAsigegaLalilx
sithxtisAthxpakatavxveV illx, malgidAga meVle jigidu matetx
savxsithxtige maraLuva shakitxyeV illx.
\num{8} (gaDiyArada racane, piVThoVpakaraN, vAhanagaLige metetx
odagisalu baLasuva suruLi sutitxda, loVhadiMda mADida,
sithxtisAthxpakatavxvuLaLx) sipxrXMgu; eguru(paTiTx) suruLi, \mo
dudx. \quad
\hyperlink{springs(2)figure}{\raisebox{-0.20cm}[0pt][0pt]{\pdfimage
    width 0.6cm height 0.6cm {S_Pictures/springs(2).jpg}}}
\num{9} (kAyaR, AcaraNe, padadhxti, \mo vugaLa) mUl; kAraN; perxVraNe;
sUPxtiR; udedxVsha; utapxtitx: \eng{the springs of human actions}
mAnava vAyxpArada, caTuvaTikeya mUlgaLu, perxVraNegaLu.
\num{10} (BAra hotatx aDaDx tole, dimimx , \mo vugaLa) meVlAbxgu;
meVlumuKvAgiruva bAgu.
\num{11} (atiyAda BAradiMda halge \mo vugaLalilx Aguva) 

\alnum{a} biruku; siVLu; oDeta. 

\alnum{b} keLabAgu; joVlu; DiVli; bagugxvike. 
\num{12} (\ashi) jeYliniMda tapipxsikoLuLxvudu yA biDugaDeyAguvudu;
seremaneyiMda parAri yA vimoVcane.}
\eentry

\num{7} (oMdu nidiRSaTx sithxti \mo vugaLalilx) iru: \eng{stand in need of help} sahAya beVkAgiru. \eng{stand accused} ApAdanege oLagAgiru. \eng{the thermometer stood at 90} uSaNxmApaka $90$ralilxtutx. \eng{the matter stands as follows} viSaya hiVgide. \eng{stands in awe of them} avara bagegx Baya gwravagaLoDane kUDidAdxne.

\num{10} (gelulxva, soVluva, \mo) niriVkeSxyalilxru yA saMBavadalilxru: \eng{what do we stand to gain by this treaty?} I opapxMdadiMda namagAguva lABaveVnu?

\gl{\pagu}

\num{7} \eng{stand at \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bay(4) pagu(8)}{${}^4$bay}.} 
\num{8} \eng{stand at \hyperref{kandict_e.pdf}{E}{ease(1) pagu}{${}^1$ease}.} 
\num{9} \eng{stand at stud = \hyperlink{stand(1)14}{${}^1$stand (\akirx\ 14)}.} 
\num{10}\eng{stand back}

\alnum{b} hiMjri; himemxTuTx; vAsatxvadaqSiTxyanunx taLeyalu mAnasikavAgi hiMdakekx sari. 
\num{11} \eng{stand by} 

\alnum{a} (pakaSx, vayxkitx, \mo varanunx) samathiRsu; etitx hiDi; beMbalisu; pakaSx vahisu; paravAgiru. 

\alnum{b} (Saratutx, vAgAdxna, \mo vanunx) pAlisu; biDade naDasu; pUreYsu; (avakekx) badadhxvAgiru. 

\alnum{c} (\nw) (lMgaru \mo vanunx hiDiyalu yA avugaLiMda kelsa mADalu) sidadhxvAgiru; ecacxradiMdiru. 

\alnum{d} hatitxraviru; samIpadalilxru; pakakxdalilxru; (madheyx parxveVshisade) niMtu noVDutitxru; sAkiSxyAgiru: \eng{will not stand by and see him beaten} pakakxdalilxdudxkoMDu avanu ETu tinunxvudanunx noVDalAre. 
\num{12} \eng{stand corrected} tapupx -- tididxko, saripaDisiko.

\alnum{b} (kAyaRniVti, AdashaR, \mo vugaLa) pakaSx vahisu; (avanunx) samathiRsu; beMbalisu: \eng{stand for free trade} mukatx vAyxpAra niVtiyanunx samathiRsu, etitx hiDi, beMbalisu. 

\alnum{c} (\AmA) (kelvomemx niSeVdhAthaRkadoDane) sahisu; tALiko; opipxko. 
\num{18} \eng{stand high} 

\alnum{a} (aMtasutx, dajeR, \mo vugaLalilx) meVliru; unanxtavAgiru.

\num{19} \eng{stand (person) in} 

\alnum{a} (\pArxparx) beleyAgu; bele tagulu; KcuR biVLu: \eng{the coat stood him in 800} koVTige avanige $800$ rUpAyi KcuR tagulitu. \eng{the car stands him in 8000 yearly for tires} moVTAru TeYrugaLigAgi avanige parxtivaSaR $8000$ rUpAyi KcARgutatxde. 

\alnum{b} (KciRnalilx) pAlugoLuLx; BAgavahisu: \eng{let me stand in with you if it is expensive} adu dubAriyAdalilx adaralilx savxlpx BAga nAnu vahisikoLuLxtetxVne. 

\alnum{c} (\kanmu\ naT yA naTiyarige) badaliyAgu; avara badalAgi avara pAtarx nivaRhisu. 
\num{20} \eng{stand in person in good \hyperlink{stead pagu(2)}{stead}.}

\alnum{b} (\birx) (kelsagArananunx) tAtAkxlikavAgi tegedu hAku; haMgAmiyAgi vajA mADu.

\num{25} \eng{stand on} 

\alnum{a} otAtxyisu; cAcU tapapxde pAlisu: \eng{stand on ceremony} sAMparxdAyika riVti rivAju gaLanunx anusarisuvaMte otAtxyisu: \eng{stand on one's dignity, rights, etc.} tananx Ganatege takakx gwrava niVDuvaMte, tananx hakukxgaLanunx maninxsuvaMte otAtxyisu.

\hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{foot nuga(34)}{foot}} (\nuga\ $34$). 
\num{29} \eng{stand out} 

\alnum{a} (guMpu \mo vugaLoDane bereyade) beVreyAgi nilulx; parxteyxVkavAgiru.

\num{30} \eng{stand over} 

\alnum{a} (vayxkitxya meVle lkaSxyX iDalu yA avananunx niyaMtirxsalu, hedarisalu \mo vugaLigAgi avana) hatitxra, samIpa -- iru; (avana meVle) nigA iDu; kaNiNxTiTxru: \eng{unless I stand over him, he makes all sorts of mistakes} nAnu avana meVle kaNiNxTiTxradidadxre avanu elAlx bageya tapupxgaLanUnx mADibiDutAtxne. 

\alnum{b} (AmeVlina itayxthaRkAkxgi sadayxdalilx ) muMdUDalAgiru; muMdakekx hAkalAgiru, taLiLxru: \eng{let the matter stand over until the next meeting} muMdina saBeyavarege I viSayavanunx muMdUDirali.

cucicxDu; sikikxsu; sikikxsiDu; neDu; nATisu (\akirx\ saha): \eng{the

\num{5} (\kanmu\ avasaradalilx) aDADxdiDiDxyAgi hAku; alilx ililx iDu:

\alnum{a} \eng{= \hyperref{kandict_l.pdf}{L}{limestone}{limestone} (Portland stone)}

\alnum{b} \eng{= \hyperlink{sandstone}{sandstone} (Bath stone).}
\num{5} (halvomemx \saMpa gaLalilx baLake) hesarisida yAvudeV nidiRSaTx
AkAradalilx yA nidiRSaTx udedxVshakekx rUpisida kalulx, shile:
\eng{tombstone} samAdhishile. \eng{stepping-stone} meTiTxlugalulx.

\num{8} 
\alnum{a} (\roVshA) (aneVka veVLe \bava dalilx \parx) (roVgada
cihenxyAgi deVhadalilxruva) gaTiTxyAda dumARMsa.

\alnum{b} (\kanmu) ashamxri; mUtarxkoVsha, pitatxkoVshagaLalilxna kalulx. 
\num{9} (\pArxparx\ yA \ashi) taruDu; vaqSaN. 
\num{10} (\bava\ adeV) (\birx) (manuSayx yA pArxNiyanunx tUka
mADuvalilx baLasuva) $14$ pwMDu (yA \eng{6.35}ke.ji.) tUkada mUlmAna. 
\num{11} \eng{= \hyperref{kandict_m.pdf}{M}{meteoric stone}{meteoric stone}.}}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu} 
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{a stone's throw} kalelxseyuvaSuTx, kalelxsetada dUra;
tiVra hatitxra; aSeTxVnU dUravallx.  
\num{2} \eng{break stones} 

\alnum{a} jalilx oDe. 

\alnum{b} jalilx oDedu hoTeTx hore, jiVvikeyanunx gaLisiko. 

\alnum{c} daTTx daridArxvasethx talupu; tiVra baDatanakekx biVLu. 
\num{3} \eng{cast (\engit{or} throw) stones \engit{or} a stone at, \engit{or} the first stone} 

\alnum{a} kalulx biVru; kalelxse. 

\alnum{b} kalelxse; (yAvudeV vayxkitxya naDateyanunx) dUSisu, niMdisu,
dUru; yAvudeV vayxkitxya (\kanmu\ shiVlda) meVle apavAda, AroVpa,
apaKAyxti -- horisu; doVSAroVpaNe mADu. 
\num{4} \eng{give a stone and
  a beating to} (modalige kudure paMdayxda \ashi) sulBavAgi
(itararanunx) mIrisu; itararigiMta migilAgu; itararanunx soVlisu. 
\num{5} \eng{give a stone for bread} roTiTxyanunx beVDidare kalulx koDu; (kelsakekx bAradadxnunx koTuTx) (BAriV) neravu niVDidaMte naTisu, sahAyada aNkavADu. 
\num{6} \eng{harden into stone} 

\alnum{a} kalAlxgu; shileyAgu; gaTiTxyAgu; GaniVkarisu. 

\alnum{b} kalAlxgu; jDavAgi hoVgu; ceYtanayx kaLeduko; aceVtanadaMtAgi hoVgu. 
\num{7} \eng{have a heart of stone} kalelxde, kalulx haqdaya -- hoMdiru; pASANhaqdayadavanAgiru; dayAdAkiSxNyxvillxdava nAgiru; manuSayxtavxvillxdavanAgiru; kaThinahaqdayanAgiru: \eng{he has a heart of stone} avanadu kaThina, kalulx -- haqdaya. 
\num{8} \eng{kill two \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bird(1) nuga(9)}{${}^1$birds} with one stone}. 
\num{9} \eng{\hyperref{kandict_l.pdf}{L}{leave(1) nuga(15)}{${}^1$leave} no stone unturned.} 
\num{10}\eng{mark with a white stone} (pArxciVna roVmanaru paMcAMgadalilx utasxvada, hababxda dinagaLanunx siVmesuNNxdiMda gurutisutitxdudxdariMda) utasxvada, saMtoVSada dinaveMdu samxrisu yA barediDu. 
\num{11} \eng{stones will cry out} (ayoyxV, anAyxya anAyxya eMdu) kalulxgaLU kUgi heVLutatxve; (BAri anAyxyavanunx tALalArade) aceVtanagaLU, nijiRVva vasutxgaLU saha hAhAkAra mADutatxve. 
\num{12} \eng{those who live in glasshouses should not throw stones} gAjina maneyalilxruvavaru itarara maneya meVle kalelxseyabAradu; tamamxlelxV huLukiruvavaru itarara huLuketitx ADabAradu.}

\num{7} (\ashi) (ETu \mo vanunx) tinunx; tinunxtitxru; edurALige parxti ETu hoDeyalArade yA edurALiya ETnunx tapipxsikoLaLxlArade hoVgu.

{\dictmeaning{
\num{1} nilulx; niMtuhoVgu; aMtayxvAgu; konegANu: \eng{the noise stopped} A gadadxl konegoMDitu. \eng{the} \eng{annuity stopped} A vaSARshanavu niMtuhoVyitu, barutitxdudxdu tapipxhoVyitu. \eng{supplies suddenly stopped} sarabarAjugaLu idadxkikxdadxMte niMtuhoVdavu. 
\num{2} (naDe, calna yA ADutitxdadx mAtu yA mADutitxdadx kelsa) nilulx; niMtubiDu; sathxgitavAgu: \eng{the car stopped outside the house} A kAru maneya horagaDe niMtitu. \eng{he stopped in the middle of a sentence} oMdu vAkayxda madhayxdalilx avana mAtu niMtubiTiTxtu, avanu tananx mAtanunx nililxsibiTTx. \eng{my watch has stopped} nananx gaDiyAra niMtuhoVgide. \eng{this train does not stop at (\engit{or} before) Kengeri} I reYlu keMgeVriyalilx (keMgeVri nilAdxNda muMde) nilulxvudillx. \eng{he never stops to think} avanu yoVcisalu kAyuvudeV illx, taDeyuvudeV illx. 
\num{3} (\AmA) iru; kAdiru; taMgiru; uLi; taMgu; savxlpx hotutx, kelvu divasa -- uLiduko: \eng{I shall stop in bed a bit longer} nAnu inUnx savxlpx hotutx hAsigeyalelxV irutetxVne. \eng{I have been stopping in Bangalore with friends} nAnu beMgaLUrinalilx senxVhitaroDane taMgidedxVne. \eng{are you going to stop for the sermon} upadeVsha BASaNvanunx keVLalu niVnu kAdiruveyA?}}

\num{7} \eng{stop down} (\CA) masUrada yA lenisxna kaMDiyanunx (savxlpx mucicx) kiridu, saNNxdu -- mADu.

\num{20} (camaR \mo\ horahodike \mo vugaLa mUlka) oLa -- hoVgisu,

\num{7} (rekekx, doVNiya huTuTx, \mo vugaLa) oMdu pUtiR -- biVsu, hoDeta.

\num{11} (Ijinalilx) kAlu, toVLugaLa biVsu; kAlu, toVLugaLanunx biVsuva riVti.

nideRVshisuva, doVNiya himUmxtige atayxMta hatitxraviruva huTuTx.}}

\num{2} (sUyaRna) beLaku; bisilu; shAK: \eng{let in the sun} sUyaRna beLakanunx oLakekx baragoDu. \eng{keep out the sun} bisilnunx oLakekx baradaMte taDe.

\num{4} (\kAparx) sUyaR; veYBava, parxBe, teVjsusx, \mo vugaLa AkaraveMdu BAvisalAda vayxkitx yA vasutx.}}

\noindent
\gl{\pagu} 
\dictmeaning{
\num{1} \eng{against the sun =
\hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{anticlockwise(1)}{${}^1$anti-clockwise}.} 
\num{2} \eng{a place in the sun} anukUl saninxveVsha yA sithxti. 
\num{3} \eng{beneath (\engit{or} under) the sun} parxpaMcadalilx elAlxdarU; loVkadalelxlAlxdarU. 
\hyperdef{S}{sun(1) pagu(4)}{}
\num{4} \eng{catch the sun} 

\alnum{a} bisilu biVLuva sathxLadalilxru. 

\alnum{b} bisillilx bADu, kaMdu. 
\num{5} \eng{hail (\engit{or} adore) the rising sun} hosa yA baraliruva adhikAriyanunx hogaLu, olisiko, avana anugarxha koVru. 
\num{6} \eng{in the sun} bisilinalilx; bisilu biVLuvaMte. 
\num{7} \eng{let not the sun go down upon your wrath} ninanx koVpa oMdu dinada maTiTxgirali; ninanx korxVdhavu saMjeyoLagAgi shAMtavAgali, aDagali. 
\num{8} \eng{make \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{hay(1) nuga(2)}{${}^1$hay} while the sun shines.}
\num{9} \eng{on which the sun never sets} (cakArxdhipatayx \mo vugaLa \vi) sUyaR muLugada; vishavxvAyxpiyAda. 
\num{10} \eng{rise with the sun} sUyoRVdayakekx ELu; hotitxge muMce ELu. 
\num{11} \eng{see the sun} badukiru; jiVvaMtavAgiru: \eng{you'll never see the sun again} niVnu matetx sUyaRnanunx kANuvudillx; niVnu inunx muMde badukalAre. 
\num{12} \eng{sun and planet} swravUyxhada, sUyaR matutx garxhagaLa
vayxvasethxya -- geVru, giyaru; madhayxdalilx halulxgaLiruva
akaSxdaMDada sutatxlU oMdoV halvoV cikakx cakarxgaLidudx, akaSxdaMDavu
tananx akaSxda meVlU, uLida cakarxgaLu adara sutatxlU tirugutAtx
cAlneyanunx odagisuva EpARDu, vayxvasethx. 
\num{13} \eng{sun in splendour} (\vaMlAM) kiraNgaLuLaLx, mAnava muKviruva sUyaR. 
\num{14} \eng{sun is set} avana, adara, \mo vugaLa -- ELigeya, aBivaqdidhxya, ucACx rxyada, utakxSaRda, kAl AgihoVyitu; mugidu hoVyitu.
